intro: Crocodilodes pungens, commonly known as the spiny crocodile plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, fleshy leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a notable species in its native habitat. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local cultures.
